org.openimaj.vis

Interface DataUnitsTransformer<Q,D,U>

  • Type Parameters:
    Q - Colour representation for the axis renderer
    D - The type of the data units
    U - The type of the converted units
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AxesRenderer2D, AxesRenderer3D, AxisRenderer2D, AxisRenderer3D

    public interface DataUnitsTransformer<Q,D,U>
    An interface for classes that can transform data units into renderer units based on the definition of the data axis in space.
    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    Created:
    26 Jun 2013

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      U calculatePosition(D units)
      For a given coordinate in the units of the data, will calculate the render coordinates
      D calculateUnitsAt(U position)
      Calculates the data unit coordinate at the given render coordinates
      void precalc()
      Force a precalculation of the variables required for the pixel transformation.
      U scaleDimension(D dimension)
      Given a specific data dimension, calculates a render dimension.

    • Method Detail

      • precalc

        void precalc()
        Force a precalculation of the variables required for the pixel transformation.

      • calculatePosition

        U calculatePosition(D units)
        For a given coordinate in the units of the data, will calculate the render coordinates
        Parameters:
        units - The unit to convert to render coordinates
        Returns:
        Render coordinates

      • calculateUnitsAt

        D calculateUnitsAt(U position)
        Calculates the data unit coordinate at the given render coordinates
        Parameters:
        position - The data rendered position to convert
        Returns:
        the data units on the given axis

      • scaleDimension

        U scaleDimension(D dimension)
        Given a specific data dimension, calculates a render dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The units/data dimension
        Returns:
        The scaled dimension
